title: a clever font? what be it?
content:
i would love to know what font this is, if anyone knows what it is or anything similar - it would be greatly appreciated. Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_4922.gif)
author: trentbrooks

comments.content:
Hmm, thought it might be Potrzebie, the freebie from Rotodesign...

[http://rotodesign.com/fonts/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358/http:/rotodesign.com/fonts/index.html "http://rotodesign.com/fonts/index.html")

...but it’s not.

Also not [Latino Rumba](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/house_industries/latino_rumba/?acs_p=1&sample_text=cleverAndy&sample_size=74) or [MVB Hotsy Totsy](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mvb_fonts/mvb_hotsy_totsy_roman/?sample_text=cleverAndy&sample_size=74), though they are in the same genre of casual latins.

It is [Desigers](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358/http:/www.dafont.com/desigers.font?nb_ppp=50&text=clever+Andy). You also might like [Atlas](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/SD10100) by [Christian Schwartz](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Christian%252BSchwartz).

[Rumba](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=142&subpage=viewfonts) by House Industries?  
Does it have alternates, maybe?  
A related thread with some more lookalikes: [http://www.typophile.com/node/4212](http://web.archive.org/web/20090520015358/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4212 "http://www.typophile.com/node/4212")
Mmmrpf, I should do a refresh before posting my guesses.
What on earth does “desigers” mean, I wonder.

BUZZ! Incorrect . . . The REAL name of this font is Ricky Nelson which was offered exclusively by Andreson Typesetting on the west coast of America . . .

At their heyday they had over 14 shops on the west coast and as part of their offerings, they released an exclusive line of typefaces . . . Among these was Bel Air originally designed by Clive Piercy and digitized by Robbie De ViIlliers later from Wilton Type . . .

There is a digital version of Ricky Nelson currently in the works (not by me) that will be released in the coming months and finally put an end to this obscure font ID . . .

BTW, it HAS already once been digitized and offered under the name Designers, no credit is visible in that version . . .

Stuart
